newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt grew 5.9 mln tonnes wheat in 1997 - state tv.
newsitem.headline: Egypt grew 5.9 mln tonnes wheat in 1997 - state tv.

text.p: Egypt has grown 5.9 million tonnes of wheat in the 1997 season, state television on Monday quoted Supply and Trade Minister Ahmed Gueily as saying.
It said Egypt had planted higher yielding varieties which helped boost production but did not give any more details.
The figure is less than the seven million tonnes which Agriculture Minister Youssef Wali was quoted late last year as saying that Egypt hoped to harvest.
In the previous season, which ended in the early summer of 1996, the country grew 5.7 million tonnes of wheat, slightly less than it initially hoped.

Despite dramatic increases in wheat production in the 1990s, Egypt is still one of the world's biggest wheat importers, buying more than four million tonnes a year, mainly from the United States, Europe and Australia. --Cairo newsroom +202 578 3290/1
